item.title: Auto parts giant LKQ says cyberattack disrupted Canadian business unit
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Automobile parts giant LKQ Corporation disclosed that one of its business units in Canada was hacked, allowing threat actors to steal data from the company. [...]

item.title: Citrix shares mitigations for ongoing Netscaler password spray attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Citrix Netscaler is the latest target in widespread password spray attacks targeting edge networking devices and cloud platforms this year to breach corporate networks. [...]

item.title: CISA confirms critical Cleo bug exploitation in ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA confirmed today that a critical remote code execution bug in Cleo Harmony, VLTrader, and LexiCom file transfer software is being exploited in ransomware attacks. [...]

item.title: FTC warns of online task job scams hooking victims like gambling
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) warns about a significant rise in gambling-like online job scams, known as "task scams," that draw people into earning cash through repetitive tasks, with the promises of earning more if they deposit their own money. [...]

item.title: CISA warns water facilities to secure HMI systems exposed online
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) warned water facilities today to secure Internet-exposed Human Machine Interfaces (HMIs) from cyberattacks. [...]

item.title: Russia blocks Viber in latest attempt to censor communications
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Russian telecommunications watchdog Roskomnadzor has blocked the Viber encrypted messaging app, used by hundreds of millions worldwide, for violating the country's legislation. [...]

item.title: Russian cyberspies target Android users with new spyware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russian cyberspies Gamaredon has been discovered using two Android spyware families named 'BoneSpy' and 'PlainGnome' to spy on and steal data from mobile devices. [...]

item.title: Germany blocks BadBox malware loaded on 30,000 Android devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Germany's Federal Office for Information Security (BSI) has disrupted the BadBox malware operation pre-loaded in over 30,000 Android IoT devices sold in the country. [...]

item.title: New stealthy Pumakit Linux rootkit malware spotted in the wild
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Linux rootkit malware called Pumakit has been discovered that uses stealth and advanced privilege escalation techniques to hide its presence on systems. [...]

item.title: Police shuts down Rydox cybercrime market, arrests 3 admins
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: International law enforcement operation seizes the Rydox cybercrime marketplace and arrests three administrators. [...]

item.title: New IOCONTROL malware used in critical infrastructure attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Iranian threat actors are utilizing a new malware named IOCONTROL to compromise Internet of Things (IoT) devices and OT/SCADA systems used by critical infrastructure in Israel and the United States. [...]

item.title: US offers $5 million for info on North Korean IT worker farms
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The U.S. State Department is offering a reward of up to $5 million for information that could help disrupt the activities of North Korean front companies and employees who generated over $88 million via illegal remote IT work schemes in six years. [...]

item.title: Cleo patches critical zero-day exploited in data theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cleo has released security updates for a zero-day flaw in its LexiCom, VLTransfer, and Harmony software, currently exploited in data theft attacks. [...]
